intro: Anemone palmata, commonly known as the common anemone, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its palmately divided leaves and showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has a short, herbaceous stem and is often found in clusters. Anemone palmata is a perennial species that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
